We have played Gordon every year on our way to whatever lake we stayed at in Ontario since 1991. On our 2nd set of Gordon gold and Gordon gold 2. We always called him the living legend and probably still will. He will live forever in our hearts.

Gordon Lightfoot was a great musician - he had passion, plus tremendous natural talent, plus musical training, plus a formal music education at a great school. I love both the simplicity and the complexity in his music. He was a masterful lyricist and a great songwriter and composer. His stories are extremely well told which is difficult in the short time of a song. I have written lyrics for about a hundred songs - they will never exist outside of my own private playing. Some of my lyrics are decent, but when I listen to a G.L. song I immediately think mine should be scrapped. In a biographical documentary, he spoke of his life and behaviors and says some of what he did was shameful. Said much of his regrettable lifestyle was fueled by a lot of alcohol. Said he will no longer play some of his own songs because of what is said in the songs. His personal introspection really impressed me. On a lighter note I really enjoy listening to his music. It is really that good.
